title: SpaceX Dragon capsule breaks U.S. spaceflight records
summary: SpaceX has now launched a flight-proven Dragon capsule to the International Space Station (ISS) 20 times. Following the successful launch and docking...

title: Why – and How – NASA Gives a Name to Every Spot It Studies on Mars
summary: Martian maps are full of monikers recognizing places on Earth, explorers, and even cartoon characters.

title: Investing in Space: Here are the rockets chasing to compete with SpaceX’s Falcon 9
summary: No rocket has been better-described as a “workhorse” than SpaceX’s Falcon 9. Historically a term reserved for the likes of ULA’s Delta II (now retired) or Russia’s Soyuz (now unavailable) or China’s Long March (also unavailable), the blistering pace of Falcon 9 missions has seen the company blow past 200 launches to date, and become the staple of the Western market.

title: Firefly Aerospace acquires Spaceflight Inc.
summary: Firefly Aerospace announced June 8 it has acquired Spaceflight Inc., adding its satellite transportation services to its portfolio of launch vehicles and spacecraft.

title: SAIC to develop ‘software factory’ for Space Development Agency
summary: The Space Development Agency awarded a $64 million contract to Science Applications International Corp. (SAIC) to develop a software applications factory for the agency’s low Earth orbit constellation.

title: ArianeGroup Renames its GEOTracker Space Surveillance Service
summary: ArianeGroup announced June 6 that it had renamed its GEOTracker space surveillance service to Helix. With the new name, the company has also rolled out new capabilities that include eye-safe laser ranging and imaging.

title: Hydrosat acquires IrriWatch
summary: IrriWatch, founded in 2019 by Wim Bastiaanssen, an expert on remote sensing and water resource management, feeds imagery and data, much of it provided by thermal sensors on government satellites, into proprietary algorithms to gauge leaf and soil temperatures, soil moisture content, water consumption and agricultural production.

title: Albedo expands staff and facilities
summary: Albedo also announced the opening June 8 of a Broomfield facility large enough to build three to four satellites simultaneously.

title: NASA concerned Starship problems will delay Artemis 3
summary: NASA has growing concerns that the lunar lander version of SpaceX’s Starship vehicle will not be ready in time for the Artemis 3 mission in late 2025, given the amount of work needed to get the vehicle ready.

title: Vulcan performs static-fire test
summary: United Launch Alliance carried out a static-fire test of its Vulcan Centaur rocket June 7, one of the final milestones before the vehicle’s first launch.
